description: Hi, I'm Sean ðŸ‘‹ A Backend Developer with extensive real-world experience in developing, testing, and deploying microservices for cloud-based, large-scale systems. I have a passion for crafting efficient, secure, and robust solutions. I also enjoy the flexibility and innovation that comes with implementing smaller projects, allowing me to stay at the forefront of new technology.
I thrive on challenges, both in the realm of software development and in life, always seeking opportunities to grow and push boundaries.

testimonials.name: Tom O'Neill
testimonials.testimonial: I had the pleasure of managing Sean, and I highly commend his exceptional skills in microservice development and DevOps. He consistently delivered high-quality work in software development and demonstrated project planning as an epic driver. He also showed he was a supportive team player and a capable leader, always ready to assist colleagues and help drive projects. A truly invaluable asset to any team.

testimonials.name: Darragh Egan
testimonials.testimonial: I had the privilege of working with Sean as part of my team for the past two years, during which time he consistently proved himself to be an exceptional developer. Sean has a remarkable ability to collaborate effectively within a team, always contributing positively and fostering a supportive working environment. I wholeheartedly recommend Sean and am confident he will excel in any endeavor he chooses to pursue.

services.title: Backend Solutions
services.description: The most robust and secure design made at a professional level.

services.title: Web Development
services.description: Building fast and responsive web applications.

education.title: Applied Software Engineering (TUS Athlone)
education.description: The software engineering master's program was specifically designed to prepare students for careers at Ericsson. The curriculum covered a wide range of essential topics, including advanced Java development, various database design methodologies, coding patterns, Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CICD), as well as a 6 week course in Kubernetes and Docker development. Additionally, the program ended with a final team project, providing hands-on experience in real-world application development scenarios.

education.title: Certificate of Software Engineering (TUS Athlone)
education.description: I enrolled in the prestigious and highly competitive software engineering program at TUS Athlone. This course, sponsored by LM Ericsson, offered an opportunity for top-performing students to gain entry into the master's program. Throughout the course, I acquired foundational knowledge in software development and, notably, honed my teamwork skills. One of the highlights was collaborating with a team to develop a website, culminating in a presentation to Ericsson management.

education.title: Electronic and Computer Engineering (University of Galway)
education.description: During my time in Galway, I discovered my passion for software development. Although my course wasn't specifically tailored to web development, I delved into programming and became captivated by modules covering distributed systems, real-time programming, and AI and machine learning.

experience.title: Ericsson
experience.description: I worked at Ericsson as a software engineer in the cloud RAN division. My role involved developing microservices using Go for performance monitoring and fault management, as well as creating CI/CD pipelines. I participated in many projects, primarily as a developer, but also took on roles such as Epic Driver and test lead. As an Epic Driver, I broke down tasks into manageable units, organized meetings to estimate story points, and created timelines with milestones to track project progression. As the test lead, I attended meetings to discuss test improvements and gathered new requirements for microservices. At Ericsson, I learnt many technical skills, teamwork, and how to utilise a team while also encouraging team members to step outside their comfort zones.

experience.title: Retail Solutions
experience.description: Retail Solutions operates as an EPOS (electronic point of sale) development firm. I began my journey with the company as a software technician, responsible for configuring software for customers upon receipt of their EPOS systems. This role encompassed database management and the detection and resolution of software bugs. I also worked with customers to resolve issues such as parts of the system going down or overall poor performance of the equipment.
